name: NSDeviceDescriptionKey
desc: These constants are the keys for device description dictionaries.

items.name: static let bitsPerSample: NSDeviceDescriptionKey
items.desc: The corresponding value is an NSNumber object containing an integer that gives the bit depth of the window’s raster image (2-bit, 8-bit, and so forth).

items.name: static let colorSpaceName: NSDeviceDescriptionKey
items.desc: The corresponding value is an NSString object giving the name of the window’s color space.

items.name: static let isPrinter: NSDeviceDescriptionKey
items.desc: If there is a corresponding value, this indicates that the display device is a printer.

items.name: static let isScreen: NSDeviceDescriptionKey
items.desc: If there is a corresponding value, this indicates that the display device is a screen.

items.name: static let resolution: NSDeviceDescriptionKey
items.desc: The corresponding value is an NSValue object containing a value of type NSSize that describes the window’s raster resolution in dots per inch (dpi).

items.name: static let size: NSDeviceDescriptionKey
items.desc: The corresponding value is an NSValue object containing a value of type NSSize that gives the size of the window’s frame rectangle.
